dk.pervasive.jcaf
Interface ContextTransformer

All Superinterfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public interface ContextTransformer
extends java.io.Serializable

This interface defines a context transformer. Classes implementing this interface can translate one type of ContextItem into another. This can be used to se up a pipline of translators, translating from one type to another by using a whole line of translators in between.

Author:
Jakob Bardram

Method Summary
 java.lang.Class[] getInType()
          Return a list of the input types for this tranlator.
 java.lang.Class getOutType()
          Return the output type for this tranlator.
 ContextItem translate(ContextItem[] in)
          This method aggregates from one ContextItem to another.
 

Method Detail

getInType

java.lang.Class[] getInType()
Return a list of the input types for this tranlator.

Returns:
An array of Classes of the ContextItems that is taken as input. Must implement ContextItem
See Also:
ContextItem

getOutType

java.lang.Class getOutType()
Return the output type for this tranlator.

Returns:
The Class of the ContextItem that it can transform an input into. Must implement ContextItem
See Also:
ContextItem

translate

ContextItem translate(ContextItem[] in)
                      throws ContextTransformerException
This method aggregates from one ContextItem to another.

Parameters:
in - the ContextItem to translate from.
Returns:
ContextItem, the translated ContextItem.
Throws:
ContextTransformerException, - if the in parameter is not of the specified type returned in the getInType() method, or if the tranlation fails for other reasons.
ContextTransformerException
